oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Found, featured, then forgotten [electronic resource] : U.S. network tv news and the Vietnam Veterans Against the War /
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Harmon, Mark D.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Knoxville, Tenn. : Newfound Press, University of Tennessee Libraries,
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: "Found, Featured, then Forgotten examines that news coverage, focusing on how U.S. television news organizations treated a very significant antiwar group, the Vietnam Veterans Against the War (VVAW). This book is not a history of the VVAW."--P. 2-3.
Title from PDF title page (Newfound Press Web site, viewed on Feb. 7, 2011).

"Found, Featured, then Forgotten examines that news coverage, focusing on how U.S. television news organizations treated a very significant antiwar group, the Vietnam Veterans Against the War (VVAW). This book is not a history of the VVAW."--P. 2-3.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Vietnam Veterans Against the War
Vietnam War, 1961-1975
Television broadcasting of news
